definition: Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrogen from excretion products (ammonium and urea) by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water
Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrate or gaseous nitrogen by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water
Parameters that classify cloud cover into types such as cumulus and cirrus.

preflabel: Chlorofluorocarbon concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of chlorofluorocarbons (also known as freons or CFCs) in sny body of water

preflabel: Zooplankton and zoobenthos development stage parameters
definition: Development stage parameters (such as proportion but excluding abundance or biomass) of zooplankton and zoobenthos. Benthic and planktonic animals have not been seggregated because there is a degree of overlap (eg shrimps).
Parameters quantifying the amount of groundwater in a given system such as aquifer water level and rate of flow of water through rock formations.
Parameters quantifying the chemistry of terrestrial groundwater bodies such as aquifers and waters percolating through rock formations.

Includes all parameters covering the strength of emitted microwave radiation return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)
Digital images of the water column obtained using either still or video cameras
Digital images of the seabed obtained using either still or video cameras
Parameters describing the location, nature and extent of objects that pose a threat to travel on the water column such as wrecks and obstructions
Parameters quantifying fauna and flora that indicate physical or chemical conditions in the water column such as colonisation depths and abundance of indicator species.
